action.action-desc: Mr. Buchanan introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the method by which the Secretary of Veterans Affairs determines the effects of a closure or disapproval of an educational institution on individuals who do not transfer credits from such institution.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Eligible to Transfer School (VETS) Credit Act.

section.header: Charge to entitlement to educational assistance for individuals who do not transfer credits from certain closed or disapproved programs of education
section.text: Section 3699(c)(2)(A) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking An individual and inserting (i) An individual;
by designating the second sentence as clause (iv) and indenting appropriately; and
by inserting after clause (i), as designated by paragraph (1), the following new clauses:

clause.text: In carrying out clause (i), the Secretary shall—

subclause.text: require an individual to certify in writing that the individual has transferred fewer than 12 credits as described in such clause;
require an individual who makes a certification under subclause (I) to acknowledge in writing that if the individual transfers 12 or more credits as described in such clause (i)—

item.text: the individual may not be deemed under such clause to be an individual who did not receive such credits; and
the Secretary shall rescind the certificate of eligibility provided under subclause (IV);

subclause.text: accept a certification under subclause (I) as proof of the individual transferring fewer than 12 credits; and

provide to the individual who makes a certification under subclause (I) and makes the acknowledgment under subclause (II) a certificate of eligibility that the individual may provide to an educational institution as proof of the individual being covered by this paragraph.

clause.text: The Secretary shall notify individuals described in subparagraph (B) of being eligible to be covered by this paragraph.
